Title:
Morpho-phylogenetic evidence reveals Ganoderma ovasporum sp.
nov. (Polyporaceae, Polyporales) from Southwest China
Keywords:
One new species, Medicinal mushrooms, Morphology,
Phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
In this study, we propose a new species, Ganoderma
ovasporum H.D. Yang, T.C. Wen sp. nov. from Guizhou Province, China.
Ganoderma ovasporum is characterized by annual, stipitate, laccate
basidiome, with red-brown to brownish-black pileus surface and pale
white pore, duplex context, clavate pellis cells, trimitic hyphal
system, ellipsoid basidiospores with a prominent wide rounded apex of
exospore. The phylogenetic analyses of combined ITS + nLSU+ RPB2 genes
confirmed that the novel species sisters to G. sandunense with high
support. Notably, we have re-examined the type specimen of Ganoderma
sandunense and provided more clear morphology of duplex context, pellis
cells and basidia. The RPB2 sequence of G. sandunense was supplied for
the first time in this study.
